result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas M Andler was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Thomas M Andler was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant can't begin programs until he has 18 months into his sentence.
Court grants 160 days credit.
Concurrent with: Count 2

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (taverns, pubs, bars, and liquor stores)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas M Andler in court, in custody, with attorney Breanne Marie Bucher.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 3 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 18 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years) - concurrent to Ct. 2  - 160 days credit
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program - Court orders the program can't begin until the defendant is 18 months into his prision sentence. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Conditions of  Extended Supervision: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Ct. 2:
- Total sentence: 6 years  (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years) - concurrent to Ct. 1  - 160 days credit
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program - Court orders the program can't begin until the defendant is 18 months into his prision sentence. . 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Conditions of  Extended Supervision: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting to be determined with his Agent as a condition of Extended Supervision
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Town of Mukwonago Police Department - append to fine  
- Transcript fee of $18.00 for Telephonic warrant to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to the DA's Office - append to fine
- Fine totaling: $1519.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - append to fine
